title: RickDeckard
author: RickDeckard
created_time: March 30, 2023, 10:30:47 PMLast edit: January 20, 2024, 12:23:39 AM by RickDeckard
content: When life happens I guess we can't fight against it - I'm sorry for absence from this event (and forum) lately. Without any further due, and after counting all the valid votes, I'm proud to announce that the winners are:A total of 82 votes were taken into account, with only two entries not being considered ( making a total of 80 edible votes):JayJuanGee - Rule broken (No merit sending is allowed from nominees to users which nominated them) 1miau - I can't split a vote into 5 As we got a final prize pool of 0.0145 BTC, here's the distribution and the amount that each user should send to the winners:Prize Pool distribution:╔══════════╦═════════════════════╦═════════════════════╦═════════════════════╗║Username║1st Winner Amounts (BTC)║2nd Winner amounts (BTC)║3rd Winner amounts  (BTC)║╠══════════╬═════════════════════╬═════════════════════╬═════════════════════╣║RickDeckard║0.0039║0.00195║0.00065║╠══════════╬═════════════════════╣═════════════════════╣═════════════════════╣║Daltonik║0.0018║0.0009║0.0003║╠══════════╬═════════════════════╣═════════════════════╣═════════════════════╣║Porfirii║0.0018║0.0009║0.0003║╠══════════╬═════════════════════╣═════════════════════╣═════════════════════╣║PowerGlove║0.0012║0.0006║0.0002║╠══════════╬═════════════════════╣═════════════════════╣═════════════════════╣║Total║0.0087║0.00435║0.00145║╚══════════╩═════════════════════╩═════════════════════╩═════════════════════╝Table interpretation: I'll have to send 0.0039 BTC to GazetaBitcoin, 0.00195 BTC to MK-74 and 0.00065 BTC to Becassine. Everyone is free to check out the math of the distribution  here.@GazetaBitcoin, @MK-74 and @Becassine - Please post your address in this topic so that we can send the funds to you. Congratulations on winning the 1st edition of the Bitcointalk pie contest .@GazetaBitcoin: I'll send a PM to @icopress with you in Cc so that you can claim your prize from our sponsor Betnomi. Congratulations for the 1st place!As a closing remark I would like to congratulate all the winners and everyone who made this contest possible, ranging from all the users who submitted their entries, the ones that voted for them and the ones that also contributed to the prize pool. You guys were incredible and I couldn't had ask for better participants! And of course, thank you for your sponsor Betnomi!I'll also have to, once again, say "Thank you" for @jayce for making an incredible signature to help advertise this contest within our community. You're the man jayce!Last but not the least, I would also like to express my gratitude for @theymos who gave an awesome support in spreading awareness for this contest by hosting it in the main banner of the forum. Again, my thanks to you Overseer!

comments.author: Becassine
comments.body: I am very happy to be on the podium, I had a lot of fun, I gained a few pounds too ... Thanks to the organizer, my voters, the participants and of course the prize contributors. Congratulations to the winners!Can't wait for the next contest, of cakes maybe ?bc1q922gtcuyszscc29nm57mnu94aslk8908qck7aw

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: RickDeckard on March 30, 2023, 10:30:47 PMWhen life happens I guess we can't fight against it - I'm sorry for absence from this event (and forum) lately.Welcome back, dear RickDeckard! I hope you are well now Quote from: RickDeckard on March 30, 2023, 10:30:47 PMtwo entries not being considered:1miau - I can't split a vote into 5 Loooooool why not? I am sure that 1miau will be very upset to see that his 0.2 votes were not awarded to his nominees  Quote from: RickDeckard on March 30, 2023, 10:30:47 PM@GazetaBitcoin, @MK-74 and @Becassine - Please post your address in this topic so that we can send the funds to you. Congratulations on winning the 1st edition of the Bitcointalk pie contest .Thank you for organizing this event, Rick! I hope it'll be reitered next year as well  Here's my address: bc1qgfluvq03jcqzvaz6dc00qqgvyvmfuxra6etsd2.Quote from: RickDeckard on March 30, 2023, 10:30:47 PM@GazetaBitcoin: I'll send a PM to @icopress with you in Cc so that you can claim your prize from our sponsor Betnomi. Congratulations for the 1st place!Thanks again!As a closing remark I would also like to congratulate all the participants, the other winners and all the contributors (icopress, theymos, Betnomi, jayce, the sponsors); and, of course, RickDeckard, which had a brilliant idea for organizing this contest!I want thank you all which voted for me! I wish I'll have the chance to share my pie with you   I did not expect to win this contest, yet I did it thanks to all of you which voted for me!

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Thanks for the contest and the votes!Happy with the 4th place, winning is not everything  .Hopefully we can see another contest like this anytime soon, maybe something pizza related like Someone already suggested.

comments.author: babygun
comments.body: Congrats to all the winners and thanks Rickdecard for organizing this contest! Had a lot of fun making the pie with my girlfriend and following the voting so up to edition 2  .

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on March 30, 2023, 11:05:56 PMThank you for organizing this event, Rick! I hope it'll be reitered next year as well  Here's my address: bc1qgfluvq03jcqzvaz6dc00qqgvyvmfuxra6etsd2.As a closing remark I would also like to congratulate all the participants, the other winners and all the contributors (icopress, theymos, Betnomi, jayce, the sponsors); and, of course, RickDeckard, which had a brilliant idea for organizing this contest!I want thank you all which voted for me! I wish I'll have the chance to share my pie with you   I did not expect to win this contest, yet I did it thanks to all of you which voted for me!Congratulations on winning the pie contest and thanks to all the participants and the organizer @RickDeckard sent you a reward according to the distribution table 0.0018 btc https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/d164ffba7bd118309044d2a03c1a1b83dfa88fd0255b7c4c48339d6008d2c700Quote from: Becassine on March 30, 2023, 10:49:52 PMI am very happy to be on the podium, I had a lot of fun, I gained a few pounds too ... Thanks to the organizer, my voters, the participants and of course the prize contributors. Congratulations to the winners!Can't wait for the next contest, of cakes maybe ?bc1q922gtcuyszscc29nm57mnu94aslk8908qck7awCongratulations for participating in the contest and for receiving the third place of honor, I also sent you your award from me 0.0003 btc https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/dc29d9d60b9d58dd5132fde05f6d2cef1dc71c7d6a65cd27bd5aa91d59947ff1We are waiting for the address from @MK-74, although he has an address in his profile, but I'd rather wait for confirmation from him here.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Congrats to all the winners. It was very beautiful to see the effort of all the participants to present their best pie. Some look quite delicious. Thank you @RickDeckard for organizing this event, and for also accepting it from the community. Next year we expect more.  Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on March 30, 2023, 11:05:56 PMI want thank you all which voted for me! I wish I'll have the chance to share my pie with you   I did not expect to win this contest, yet I did it thanks to all of you which voted for me!@GazetaBitcoin don't make excuses! You should have shared your pie with everyone! You and all other participants!  For next year, I'll only vote if I try the pies!

comments.author: MK-74
comments.body: First of all, thank you very much to everyone.I am very happy to be the second place. It was a very good competition.Here's my address:   bc1qlv05kxqu66qy3pugs2fdeamshrdsk3xtwhr9cz

comments.body: Quote from: MK-74 on March 31, 2023, 07:11:45 AMFirst of all, thank you very much to everyone.I am very happy to be the second place. It was a very good competition.Here's my address:   bc1qlv05kxqu66qy3pugs2fdeamshrdsk3xtwhr9czI would like to congratulate you on the second place a little short of victory, but still ahead of luck  , I sent 0.0009 btc for the second place https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/4d87602eacf71458cd8974ba570fb263def1d8fbd4bb19195b97cf1eca2d01f6

comments.author: jayce
comments.body: Congrats for the winners, and thanks RickDeckard for bringing another fun event on bitcointalk. It's not easy to initiate this event but you made it, not just because of your strong initiative only, but also your great attitude towards everyone. People can feel it and we enjoy this event together. Thanks to icopress, betnomi, and theymos for the support. Well seems we gonna need a Bitcointalk's calendar where all of important events in this forum could be written there, such as this pie contest, pizza, and pumping carving.Btw sorry for not joining the vote, as I had so many favorites in my mind. It would be just useless if I kept putting multiple votes because it wouldn't be counted lol. Damn I really want to taste all of those pies. Cheers guys!

comments.author: PowerGlove
comments.body: Congrats to @GazetaBitcoin, @MK-74 and @Becassine! You all had excellent entries, well done! I didn't vote, because I couldn't decide who had the yummiest-looking pie. Maybe next year we can use a system where each voter gets 10 points to spend on up to 5 entries, or something like that?I've sent my allocation [1] of the prize pool (787a73f365d2b207f26444fdde642392d95f10e41d900c5fa5d37702ab5644a8).[1] I used the figures in the linked spreadsheet, because there was a small mistake in the OP (0.002 vs. 0.0002 for Becassine).

comments.author: Porfirii
comments.body: Congratulations GazetaBitcoin, MK-74 and Becassine!! And special thanks to AHOYBRAUSE for his efforts: you deserved a prize too, but you get the recognition of the forum instead, which is not bad either Rewards are on their way:1st prize: https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/705bfd28d2657fd9c2921cd240a6cce4c05ab893325d3456a24a053b7eb5d5462nd prize: https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/60c82202de9f13eb86462919446c6aba39e3e9ad054ffe178f9338230f1149053rd prize: https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/b52430e74f801d2a704bcba58de5a3cf66bbd1aaf6021480882c4eb3c0c95175Enjoy!

comments.author: UserU
comments.body: Man, the competition is indeed strong after seeing some very solid entries, save for the plagiarizer. Grats to the winners!

comments.author: Becassine
comments.body: Thank you, thank you for the prize !

comments.author: onurgozupek
comments.body: Congrats... Hope someday you will cook for all of us 😀

comments.author: LDL
comments.body: Pie baking contest was organized in colorful fun for few days.Voting competition result of that contest was declared today. It was a pleasure to participate in this joyous festival. I hope to be able to participate in such a joyful contest every year. Finally, many best wishes and congratulations to those who have won this contest.Also congratulations to @RickDeckard who organized this unique contest and helped make it a success.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: RickDeckard thanks for organizing a successful campaign and I guess this beats the first by a mile  Just hope this will become a yearly event,  so that we can prepare for it And to the winner's congratulations well deserved, just wished we could have a bite in those delicious looking pies  !

comments.author: RickDeckard
comments.created_time: April 03, 2023, 08:47:05 PMLast edit: April 17, 2023, 10:48:33 PM by RickDeckard
comments.body: I guess it's better late than never... I'm sorry that I was only able to send yesterday but considering the fees that I've used I'm sure that by now you've noticed that I also paid for my part of the pot. You can check the transaction here[1].Thank you @Porfirii, @Daltonik and @PowerGlove for the timely transactions, you guys went beyond the call of duty!I'll keep the thread open for one more week and then I'll close it as a way to end the chapter of this year pie baking contest. Once again, congratulations to all the winners!EDIT 17/04: Shame on me, two weeks have passed. Guess it is time to lock the thread. Once again, thank you everyone that was involved in this contest![1]https://mempool.space/tx/1efee816293bbcc0b81fa02bddd143b678e1c32e81b54c4d8db4c6a3650906b0
